The significance of the region in Japan is geographical, cultural and administrative. ==History== In the late 7th century, the Kinki region were identified as one of the eight largest administrative areas of the Imperial system (ritsuryo seido). Gokishichidō is an ancient system of names for parts of the country, including Kinki or Kansai. Kansai covers the area around the capital city of Kyoto on the island of HonshūLOC, "Kinki". Retrieved 2012-4-15. in roughly the same area as the traditional Kinki. In the Meiji period, the modern regional system was made by Imperial decree. Japan was divided into regions (chihō ), including the Kinki region. A regional council (chihō gyōsei kyōgisai) was headed by the governor of the most powerful prefecture in the regional grouping.
